intro: Phlebolithis indica, commonly known as the Indian phlebolith, is a flowering plant native to South Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The botanical features of Phlebolithis indica make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
